abstract.text: The initial block subsidy which defaults to 5 billion satoshis or 50 bitcoins.
Adds a transaction to the mempool.

A block of transactions. It may be interpreted as a just a block header when body of transactions is empty. It may also include additional contextual information such as the block’s height within the blockchain.
Returns a copy of self without the transactions – i.e. header only.
The maximum allowed weight for a block, see BIP141 (network rule)
Finds transactions in mempool and blocks which match any of the provided IDs.
To create the block locator hashes, keep pushing hashes until you go back to the genesis block. After pushing 10 hashes back, the step backwards doubles every loop.
The number of blocks needed to be mined until a coinbase output may be spent. Defaults to 100.
Gets a transaction by ID looking into mempool and blocks.
Coinbase transaction outputs can only be spent after this number of new blocks (network rule)
Bitcoin service layer namely transaction blocks, block headers, transaction memory pool (
